subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The law requires that nearly everything be cleansed with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness. (Hebrews 9:22) NIV
reflection: Why does forgiveness require the shedding of blood? This is no arbitrary decree on the part of a bloodthirsty God as some have suggested. There is no greater symbol of life than blood, blood keeps us alive. Jesus shed His blood--gave His life--for our sins so that we wouldn't have to experience spiritual death, eternal separation from God. Jesus is the source of life, not death. He gave His own life to pay our penalty for us so that we might live. After shedding His blood for us, Christ rose from the grave and proclaimed victory over sin and death.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word today, I thank You for the reminder that it is not anything that I have done that warrants eternal life, but that it is nothing but the blood of Christ that guarantees that my sins have been washed away. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A GREAT DAY!!!~~~(food for thought )~~~Your children get only one childhood--make it memorable...

Our Meditation for Today:

The law requires that nearly everything be cleansed
with blood, and without the shedding of blood there
is no forgiveness...(Heb. 9:22) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Why does forgiveness require the shedding of blood?

This is no arbitrary decree on the part of a blood-thirsty God
as some have suggested. There is no greater symbol of life
than blood, blood keeps us alive...

Jesus shed His blood--gave His life--for our sins so that we
wouldn't have to experience spiritual death, eternal separation
from God...

Jesus is the source of life, not death. He gave His own life to
pay our penalty for us so that we might live. After shedding His
blood for us, Christ rose from the grave and proclaimed victory 
over sin and death...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word today, I thank You
for the reminder that it is not anything that I have done that warrants 
eternal life, but that it is nothing but the blood of Christ that guarantees
that my sins have been washed away...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For Christ did not enter a man-made sanctuary that was only a copy of the true one; He entered heaven itself, now to appear for us in God's presence. (Hebrews 9:24) NIV
reflection: Among references to priests, tabernacles, sacrifices, and other ideas unfamiliar to us, we come to this description of Christ as our Advocate, appearing in God's presence on our behalf. We can relate to this role and be encouraged by it. Christ is on our side at God's side. He is our Lord and Savior. He is not there to convince or remind God that our sins are forgiven but to present both our needs and our service for Him as an offering. (see Hebrews 7:25).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Christ's work as my Advocate. I thank You for His role as my Lord and Savior. Accept my humble plea for forgiveness. Bless all my e-mail friends, keep them safe and healthy. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A GREAT DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Read the Psalm. They cover every human emotion...

For Christ did not enter a man-made sanctuary that was

Among references to priests, tabernacles, sacrifices, and other
ideas unfamiliar to us, we come to this description of Christ as
our Advocate, appearing in God's presence on our behalf...

We can relate to this role and be encouraged by it. Christ is on
our side at God's side. He is our Lord and Savior. 

He is not there to convince or remind God that our sins are forgiven 
but to present both our needs and our service for Him as an offering...(see Heb. 7:25).

Our Prayer for Today:

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Then Christ would have had to suffer many times since the creation of the world. But now He has appeared once for all at the end of the ages to do away with sin by the sacrifice of Himself. (Hebrews 9:26) NIV
reflection: All people have to die physically, but Christ died so that we would not have to die spiritually. We can have a wonderful confidence in His saving work for us, doing away with all our sins. The "end of the age" refers to the time of Christ's coming to earth in fulfillment of the Old T. prophecies. Christ ushered in the new era of grace and forgiveness. We are still living in the "end of the age." The day of the Lord has begun and will be completed at Christ's return.
prayer: Most Gracious Heavenly Father, what a wonderful gift we have received by Your grace, the gift of eternal life. Yet we wait dear Lord for the wonderful day when our Lord Jesus Christ will return to usher us to our eternal home. I pray for a true revival in the hearts of those who do not have the assurance of eternal life. I pray that the Holy Spirit would be able to awaken those sleeping hearts. Amen.
original_content:

for all at the end of the ages to do away with sin by the

Our Thought for Today:

All people have to die physically, but Christ died so that we 
would not have to die spiritually. We can have a wonderful 
confidence in His saving work for us, doing away with all our
sins...

The "end of the age" refers to the time of Christ's coming to
earth in fulfillment of the Old T. prophecies. Christ ushered
in the new era of grace and forgiveness...

We are still living in the "end of the age." The day of the Lord
has begun and will be completed at Christ's return...

Our Prayer for Today:

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The law is only a shadow of the good things that are coming-not the realities themselves. For this reason it can never, by the same sacrifice repeated endlessly year after year, make perfect those who draw near to worship. If it could, would they not have stopped being offered? For the worshipers would have been cleansed once for all, and would no longer have felt guilty for their sins. But those sacrifices are an annual reminder of sins--(Hebrews 10:1-3) NIV
reflection: When people gathered for the offering of sacrifice on the Day of Atonement, they were reminded of their sins, and they undoubtedly felt guilty all over again. What they needed most was forgiveness--the permanent, powerful, sin-destroying forgiveness we have from Christ. When we confess a sin to Him, we need never think of it again. Christ has forgiven us, and the sin no longer exists. (see I John 1:9).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the permanent, powerful, sin-destroying forgiveness we have from Christ. I thank You for washing all my guilt away. Bless and keep each of my e-mail friends safe and healthy. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~If we all threw our problems in a pile and saw everyone else's,
We'd hurry and grab ours back...

Our Meditation for Today:

The law is only a shadow of the good things that are coming-not the realities themselves. For this reason it can never, by
the same sacrifice repeated endlessly year after year, make
perfect those who draw near to worship.

If it could, would they not have stopped being offered? For
the worshipers would have been cleansed once for all, and
would no longer have felt guilty for their sins...

But those sacrifices are an annual reminder of sins--(Heb. 10:1-3) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

When people gathered for the offering of sacrifice on the Day of Atonement,
they were reminded of their sins, and they undoubtedly felt guilty all over again.

What they needed most was forgiveness--the permanent, powerful, sin-destroying 
forgiveness we have from Christ. When we confess a sin to Him, we need never 
think of it again...

Christ has forgiven us, and the sin no longer exists. (see I Jn. 1:9).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the permanent, 
powerful, sin-destroying forgiveness we have from Christ.
I thank You for washing all my guilt away...Bless and keep
each of my e-mail friends safe and healthy...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: First He said, "Sacrifices and offerings, burnt offerings and sin offerings You did not desire, nor were You pleased with them" (although the law required them to be made). Then He said, "Here I am, I have come to do Your will." He sets aside the first to establish the second. (Hebrews 10:8, 9) NIV
reflection: Canceling the first covenant in order to establish a far better one meant doing away with the system of sacrifice contained in the ceremonial law. It didn't mean eliminating God's moral law (the Ten Commandments). The ceremonial law prepared people for Christ's coming. With Christ's death and resurrection, that system was no longer needed. Now through Christ we can fulfill the moral law as we allow Him to live in us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the better covenant, that you gave us through Your Son our Lord Jesus Christ. I thank You that sacrifices are no longer needed. I thank You for the perfect sacrifice that was made in the death of our Savior. Give me an obedient spirit that I may faithfully live in obedience to Your Holy Spirit. Amen.
original_content:

them" (although the law required them to be made).

Then He said, "Here I am, I have come to do Your will." He
sets aside the first to establish the second...(Heb. 10:8, 9) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Canceling the first covenant in order to establish a far better one 
meant doing away with the system of sacrifice contained in the 
ceremonial law. It didn't mean eliminating God's moral law (the
Ten Commandments).

The ceremonial law prepared people for Christ's coming. With 
Christ's death and resurrection, that system was no longer needed.

Now through Christ we can fulfill the moral law as we allow Him to
live in us...

Our Prayer for Today:

You that sacrifices are no longer needed. I thank You for the

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And by that will, we have been made holy through the sacrifice of the body of Jesus Christ once for all. Day after day every priest stands and performs his religious duties; again and again he offers the same sacrifice, which can never take away sins. But when this priest had offered for all time one sacrifice for sins, He sat down on the right hand of God. (Hebrews 10:10-12) NIV
reflection: Christ's work is contrasted with the work of the Jewish priests. The priests' work was never finished, so they had to stand day after day and offer sacrifices; Christ's sacrifice (dying in our place) is finished, so He is seated. The priests repeated the sacrifices often; Christ sacrificed once for all. The sacrifice system couldn't completely remove sin; Christ's sacrifice effectively cleansed us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the sacrifice Christ made for me on the cross. I thank You for the cleansing power of His shed blood. I pray that one day soon all would come to the knowledge of this truth. Dear Lord, watch over our troops, and protect them from the dangers that they encounter each and every day. Amen.

He sat down on the right hand of God...(Heb. 10:10-12) NIV

Christ's work is contrasted with the work of the Jewish priests.
The priests' work was never finished, so they had to stand day
after day and offer sacrifices; Christ's sacrifice (dying in our place) 
is finished, so He is seated...

The priests repeated the sacrifices often; Christ sacrificed once for all.
The sacrifice system couldn't completely remove sin; Christ's sacrifice
effectively cleansed us...

them from the dangers that they encounter each and every day...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Because by one sacrifice He has made perfect forever those who are being made holy. (Hebrews 10:14) NIV
reflection: We have been made perfect, yet we are being made holy. Through His death and resurrection, Christ, once for all, made His believers perfect in God's sight. At the same time, He is making them holy (progressively cleansed and set apart, for His special use) in their daily pilgrimage here. We should not be surprised, ashamed, or shocked that we still need to grow. God is not finished with us. we can encourage this growth process by deliberately applying Scripture to all areas of our life, by accepting the discipline and guidance Christ provides, and by giving Him control of our desires and goals.
prayer: Dear Lord, in You a place my trust, that I may become more perfect. I know that I still have a lot of growing to do, so I place myself under Your control. Help me to accept Your discipline and guidance I pray in Jesus name Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: This is the covenant I will make with them after that time, says the Lord. I will put my laws in their hearts, and I will write them on their minds. Then He adds: Their sins and lawless acts I will remember no more." (Hebrews 10:16, 17) NIV
reflection: The writer concludes his argument with this powerful statement that God will remember our sins no more. Christ forgives completely, so there is no need to confess our past sins repeatedly. As Believers, we can be confident that the sins we confess and renounce are forgiven and forgotten.
prayer: I thank You Lord, for the assurance that once confessed my sins are forgive and forgotten. I now ask for forgiveness of my sins of though word and deed that I have committed today. I ask that You lay your hand of protection and good health upon all my e-mail friends. Amen.

no more." (Heb. 10:16, 17) NIV

that God will remember our sins no more...

Christ forgives completely, so there is no need to confess our 
past sins repeatedly. As Believers, we can be confident that the 
sins we confess and renounce are forgiven and forgotten...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Let us draw near to God with a sincere heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled to cleanse us from a guilty conscience and having our bodies washed with pure water. Let us hold unswervingly to the hope we profess, for He who promised is faithful. And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds. (Hebrews 10:22-24) NIV
reflection: If we truly stop and think about it, we have significant privileges associated with our new life in Christ: (1) We have personal access to God through Christ and can draw near to Him without an elaborate system (Hebrews 10:22). (2) We may grow in faith, overcome doubts and questions, and deepen our relationship with God (Hebrews 10:23). (3) We may enjoy encouragement from one another (Hebrews 10:24). (4) We may worship together (Hebrews 10:25). Let us not overlook or forsake these privileges.
prayer: I thank You Lord, for the personal relationship that has become ours through Jesus Christ. I thank You for the relationship which becomes more personal through faith. I thank You for the fellowship of other believers. I Thank You for the fellowship that is ours even through e-mail. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The best is yet to come, just be ready to receive it...

Let us draw near to God with a sincere heart in full assurance
of faith, having our hearts sprinkled to cleanse us from a guilty
conscience and having our bodies washed with pure water...

Let us hold unswervingly to the hope we profess, for He who 
promised is faithful...

And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward
love and good deeds...(Heb. 10:22-24) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

If we truly stop and think about it, we have significant privileges
associated with our new life in Christ:

(1) We have personal access to God through Christ and can draw 
near to Him without an elaborate system (Heb. 10:22).

(2) We may grow in faith, overcome doubts and questions, and
deepen our relationship with God (Heb. 10:23).

(3) We may enjoy encouragement from one another (Heb. 10:24).

(4) We may worship together (Heb. 10:25).

Let us not over-look or forsake these privileges...

Our Prayer for Today:
I thank You Lord, for the personal relationship that has become
ours through Jesus Christ. I thank You for the relationship which
becomes more personal through faith. I thank You for the fellowship
of other believers...I Thank You for the fellowship that is ours even
through e-mail...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Let us not give up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but let us encourage one another, and all the more as you see the Day approaching. (Hebrews 10:25) NIV
reflection: To neglect Christian meetings is to give up the encouragement and help of other Christians. We should gather together to share our faith and to strengthen one another in the Lord. As we get closer to the Day when Christ will return, we will face many spiritual struggles, and even times of persecution. Anti-Christian forces will grow in strength. But difficulties should never be an excuses for missing Church service. Rather, as difficulties arise, we should make an even greater effort to be faithful in attendance.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the fellowship and the strength I receive from other believers as we meet together. I thank You for the oneness that comes from other Christians as we come together. I thank You for Your grace and mercy. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If we deliberately keep on sinning after we have received the knowledge of the truth, no sacrifice for sins is left. (Hebrews 10:26) NIV
reflection: When people deliberately reject Christ's offer of salvation, they reject God's most precious gift. They ignore the leading of the Holy Spirit, the one who communicates to us God's saving love. This warning was given to Jewish Christians who were tempted to reject Christ for Judaism, but it applies to anyone who rejects Christ for another religion, OR, having understood Christ's atoning work, deliberately turns away from it. The point is there is no other acceptable sacrifice for sin than the death of Christ on the cross. If someone deliberately rejects the sacrifice of Christ after clearly understanding the Good News teaching about it, then there is no way for that person to be saved, because God has not provided any other name in all of heaven for the people to call on to save them (Acts 4:12).
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for the atoning work of Christ. I thank You for the Good News of salvation. Thy Word is a lamp onto my feet and a light onto my path. Amen.
original_content:

saving love...

This warning was given to Jewish Christians who were tempted
to reject Christ for Judaism, but it applies to anyone who rejects

work, deliberately turns away from it...

The point is there is no other acceptable sacrifice for sin than the 
death of Christ on the cross. If someone deliberately rejects the 
sacrifice of Christ after clearly understanding the Good News
teaching about it, then there is no way for that person to be saved,
because God has not provided any other name in all of heaven for 
the people to call on to save them (Acts 4:12).

I thank You for the Good News of salvation. Thy Word

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For we know Him who said, "It is mine to avenge; I will repay, " and again, "The Lord will judge His people." It is a dreadful thing to fall into the hands of the living God. (Hebrews 10:30, 31) NIV
reflection: This judgment is for those who have rejected God's mercy. For those who accept Christ's love and His salvation, the coming judgment is no cause for worry. Being save through His grace, they have nothing to fear. There is no fear in love. but perfect love drives out fear, because fear has to do with punishment. the one who fears is not made perfect in love. (1 John 4:18)
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your loving-kindness. I thank You that we can resolve all our fears first by focusing on Your immeasurable love for us, and then by allowing You to love others through us. Your love O Lord stills my fears and gives me confidence. Bless me e-mail friends with safety and good health. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not throw away your confidence; it will be richly rewarded. You need to persevere so that when you have done the will of God, you will receive what he has promised. For in just a very little while, "He who is coming will come and will not delay. (Hebrews 10:35-37) NIV
reflection: What we need to realize here is that we are encouraged not to abandon our faith in times of persecution, and suffering but we must show our endurance and that our faith is real. What faith is really all about is that we are resting in what Christ has done for us in the past, as well as what He will do for us in the present and the future. (see Romans 8:12-25; Galatians 3:10-13).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for your promise of adoption for all who put their faith in Christ. I thank You for what He did in the past and what He is doing now and what he will do in the future. Nothing that I have had to endure compares with the great price that Christ paid to save me. Amen.

What faith is really all about is that we are resting in what Christ

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now faith is being sure of what we hoped for and certain of what we do not see. (Hebrews 11:1) NIV
reflection: The beginning point of faith is believing in God's character: He is who He says He is. The end point is believing in God's promises: He will do what He says. When we believe that God will fulfill His promises even though we don't see those promises materializing yet, we demonstrate true faith (see John 20:24-31).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would continue to grow in faith and not become a doubting Thomas. I thank You for the promise that on day I shall see Your physical presence, but until that time I thank you for the gift of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~A real friend in one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out...

Our Meditation for Today:

Now faith is being sure of what we hoped for and
certain of what we do not see...(Heb. 11:1) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The beginning point of faith is believing in God's character: 
He is who He says He is...

The end point is believing in God's promises:
He will do what He says...

When we believe that God will fulfil His promises even though
we don't see those promises materializing yet, we demonstrate
true faith (see Jn. 20:24-31)...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would continue to grow in faith
and not become a doubting Thomas. I thank You for the promise 
that on day I shall see Your physical presence, but until that time I 
thank you for the gift of the Holy Spirit...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith we understand that the universe was formed at God's command, so that what is seen was not made out of what is visible. (Hebrews 11:3) NIV
reflection: God called the universe into existence out of nothing; He declared that it was to be, and it was. Our faith is to be in the God who created the entire universe by His word. God's word has awesome power. When He speaks, do you listen and respond? How can you better prepare yourself to respond to God's word??? We need to continually pray for sensitive hearts.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, great and awesome is Your power, in You I put my trust. Help me to be more sensitive and obedient to Your Holy Spirit's leading. Protect our troops from all danger. Be with the grieving families, give them a peace that passes all understanding, through Jesus Christ. Amen.

HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Life is simpler when you plow around a stump.

By faith we understand that the universe was formed at
God's command, so that what is seen was not made out
of what is visible...(Heb. 11:3) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

God called the universe into existence out of nothing; He declared
that it was to be, and it was...

Our faith is to be in the God who created the entire universe by His 
word. God's word has awesome power. When He speaks, do you 
listen and respond?

How can you better prepare yourself to respond to God's word???
We need to continually pray for sensitive hearts...

Dear Heavenly Father, great and awesome is Your power,

obedient to Your Holy Spirit's leading. Protect our troops 
from all danger. Be with the grieving families, give them a 
peace that passes all understanding, through Jesus Christ...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith Abel offered God a better sacrifice than Cain did. by faith he was commended as a righteous man, when God spoke well of His offerings. And by faith he still speaks, even though he is dead. (Hebrews 11:4) NIV
reflection: Cain and Abel were Adam and Eve's first two sons. Abel offered a sacrifice that pleased God, while Cain's sacrifice was unacceptable. Abel's sacrifice (an animal substitute) was more acceptable to God, both because it was a blood sacrifice and, most important, because of Abel's attitude when he offered it. What is your attitude when you bring your offering to God? Is it one of gratefulness because of what God has done for you? Or do you give grudgingly and stingily???
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, give me a heart of love and compassion, help me to always give not out of compulsion or grudgingly but from a loving heart with gratitude. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Meanness don't just happen over night...

Our Meditation for Today:

By faith Abel offered God a better sacrifice than Cain did.
by faith he was commended as a righteous man, when 
God spoke well of His offerings. And by faith he still 
speaks, even though he is dead...(Heb. 11:4) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Cain and Abel were Adam and Eve's first two sons.
Abel offered a sacrifice that pleased God, while Cain's
sacrifice was unacceptable...

Abel's sacrifice (an animal substitute) was more acceptable 
to God, both because it was a blood sacrifice and, most
important, because of Abel's attitude when he offered it...

What is your attitude when you bring your offering to God?

Is it one of gratefulness because of what God has done for you?

Or do you give grudgingly and stingily???

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, give me a heart of love and compassion,
help me to always give not out of compulsion or grudgingly but
from a loving heart with gratitude...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to Him must believe that He exists and that He rewards those who earnestly seek Him. (Hebrews 11:6) NIV
reflection: Believing that God exists is only the beginning; even the demons believe that much (James 2:19, 20). God will not settle for mere acknowledgment of His existence. He wants a personal, dynamic relationship with you that will transform your life. Those who seek God will find that they are rewarded with His intimate presence.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and wanting to have a personal relationship with Your people. I thank You for the power that relationship has in my life. To know You (that personal relationship) is to love You. Amen.

rewards those who earnestly seek Him...(Heb. 11:6) NIV

He wants a personal, dynamic relationship with you that will
transform your life...

intimate presence...

You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith Noah, when warned about things not yet seen, in holy fear built an ark to save his family. By his faith he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness that comes by faith. (Hebrews 11:7) NIV
reflection: Noah experienced rejection because He was different from his neighbors. God commanded Noah to build a large boat in the middle of dry land, and although God's command seemed foolish, Noah obeyed. Noah's obedience made him appear strange to his neighbors, just as the new beliefs of the Jewish Christians undoubtedly made them stand out. As you obey God, don't be surprised if others regard you as "different." Your obedience makes their disobedience stand out. Remember, if God asks you to do something, He will give you the necessary strength to carry out that task.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be found faithful, following Your commands. May I always be a Christlike example to my peers. Bless my friends with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Do not corner something you know is meaner than you...

By faith Noah, when warned about things not yet seen,
in holy fear built an ark to save his family. By his faith
he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness that comes by faith...(Heb. 11:7) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Noah experienced rejection because He was different from 
his neighbors...

God commanded Noah to build a large boat in the middle of
dry land, and although God's command seemed foolish, Noah
obeyed...

Noah's obedience made him appear strange to his neighbors,
just as the new beliefs of the Jewish Christians undoubtedly
made them stand out...

As you obey God, don't be surprised if others regard you as
"different." Your obedience makes their disobedience stand 
out...

Remember, if God asks you to do something, He will give you
the necessary strength to carry out that task...

good health and safety...Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith Abraham, when called to go to a place he would later receive as his inheritance, obeyed and went, even though he did not know where he was going. By faith he made his home in the promised land like a stranger in a foreign country; he lived in tents, as did Isaac and Jacob, who were heirs with him of the same promise. For he was looking forward to the city with foundations whose architect and builder is God. (Hebrews 11:8-10) NIV
reflection: Abraham's life was filled with faith. At God's command, he left home and went to another land, obeying with out question. (Genesis 12:1ff). He believed the covenant that God made with him. In obedience to God, Abraham was even willing to sacrifice his son Isaac (Genesis 22:1-19). Do not be surprised if God asks you to give up secure, familiar surroundings in order to carry out His will.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, create in me a faith like Abraham. Create in me a sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit so that I would faithfully follow Your will for me. Bless and protect our troops. Comfort the families who have lost loved ones because of this war. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(Food for thought)~~~It don't take a very big person to carry a grudge...

Our Meditation for Today:

By faith Abraham, when called to go to a place he would
later receive as his inheritance, obeyed and went, even
though he did not know where he was going...

By faith he made his home in the promised land like a
stranger in a foreign country; he lived in tents, as did 
Isaac and Jacob, who were heirs with him of the same 
promise...

For he was looking forward to the city with foundations
whose architect and builder is God...(Heb. 11:8-10) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Abraham's life was filled with faith. At God's command, he
left home and went to another land, obeying with out question.
(Gen. 12:1ff)...

He believed the covenant that God made with him. In obedience
to God, Abraham was even willing to sacrifice his son Isaac (Gen.
22:1-19)...

Do not be surprised if God asks you to give up secure, familiar
surroundings in order to carry out His will...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, create in me a faith like Abraham.
Create in me a sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit so that I would 
faithfully follow Your will for me. Bless and protect our troops.
Comfort the families who have lost loved ones because of this
war... Amen. 

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith Abraham, even though he was past age, and Sarah herself was barren, was enabled to become a father because He considered him faithful who had made the promise. And so from this one man, and he as good as dead, came descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky and as countless as the sand on the seashore. All these people were still living by faith when they died. They did not receive the things promised; They only saw them and welcomed them from a distance. And they admitted that they were aliens and strangers on earth. (Hebrews 11:11-13) NIV
reflection: We need to keep in mind that we are "foreigners and nomads." This might be an awareness forced on us by circumstances. It may come late in life or as a result of difficult times. Yes this world is not our home, we cannot live here forever (I Peter 1:1). It is best if we do not become so attached to this world's desires and possessions that we can't move out at God's command.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, guide me in following the course You have laid out for me and all Your children. Keep us mindful of the fact that we are truly aliens here. forgive me when I become so attached to worldly possessions that I am not in tune with Your will. May I always look upon the gift of eternal life as the greatest possession I have been given so as to put that above all else. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~You can not unsay a cruel word...

Our Meditation for Today:

By faith Abraham, even though he was past age, and Sarah
herself was barren, was enabled to become a father because 
He considered him faithful who had made the promise.

And so from this one man, and he as good as dead, came 
descendents as numerous as the stars in the sky and as
countless as the sand on the seashore...

All these people were still living by faith when they died. They
did not receive the things promised; They only saw them and
welcomed them from a distance. And they admitted that they 
were aliens and strangers on earth...(Heb. 11:11-13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

We need to keep in mind that we are "foreigners and nomads."
This might be an awareness forced on us by circumstances.
It may come late in life or as a result of difficult times...

Yes this world is not our home, we cannot live here forever (I Pet 1:1).

It is best if we do not become so attached to this world's desires
and possessions that we can't move out at God's command...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, guide me in following the course 
You have laid out for me and all Your children. Keep us
mindful of the fact that we are truly aliens here. forgive me
when I become so attached to worldly possessions that I 
am not in tune with Your will. May I always look upon the 
gift of eternal life as the greatest possession I have been 
given so as to put that above all else...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith Abraham, when God tested him, offered Isaac as a sacrifice. He who had received the promise was about to sacrifice his one and only son, even though God had said to him, "It is through Isaac that your offspring will be reckoned." Abraham reasoned that God could raise the dead, and figuratively speaking, he did receive Isaac back from death. (Hebrews 11:17-19) NIV
reflection: Abraham was willing to give up his son when God commanded him to do so (Genesis 22:1-19). God did not let Abraham take Isaac's life, because God had given the command in order to test Abraham's faith. Instead of taking Abraham's son, God gave Abraham a whole nation of descendants through Isaac. If you are afraid to trust God with the possession, dream, or person you treasure most, pay attention to Abraham's example. Because Abraham was willing to give up everything for God, he received back more than he could have imagined. However, what we receive, is not always immediate or in the form of material possessions. Material things should be among the least satisfying of rewards. Our best and greatest rewards await us in eternity.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the great example that we have in Abraham. I pray that my faith would one day become like his. I do confess that I fall way short of the faith that I should have. forgive me for this I pray. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Every path has a few puddles...

Our Meditation for Today:

By faith Abraham, when God tested him, offered Isaac
as a sacrifice. He who had received the promise was
about to sacrifice his one and only son,

even though God had said to him, "It is through Isaac 
that your offspring will be reckoned."

Abraham reasoned that God could raise the dead, and 
figuratively speaking, he did receive Isaac back from death...
(Heb. 11:17-19) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Abraham was willing to give up his son when God commanded him
to do so (Gen. 22:1-19).

God did not let Abraham take Isaac's life, because God had given 
the command in order to test Abraham's faith. Instead of taking 
Abraham's son, God gave Abraham a whole nation of descendents
through Isaac...

If you are afraid to trust God with the possession, dream, or person you 
treasure most, pay attention to Abraham's example... Because Abraham 
was willing to give up everything for God, he received back more than 
he could have imagined...

However, what we receive, is not always immediate or in the form of 
material possessions. Material things should be among the least 
satisfying of rewards. Our best and greatest rewards await us in 
eternity...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the great example
that we have in Abraham. I pray that my faith would one
day become like his. I do confess that I fall way short of
the faith that I should have. forgive me for this I pray...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau in regard to their future. By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of Joseph's sons, and worshiped as he leaned on the top of his staff. (Hebrews 11:20, 21) NIV
reflection: Jacob was Isaac's son and Abraham's grandson. Jacob's sons became the fathers of Israel's 12 tribes. Even when Jacob (also called "Israel") was dying in a strange land, he believed the promise that Abraham's descendants would be like the sand on the seashore and that Israel would become a great nation. True faith helps us see beyond the grave. True faith brings us to a personal relationship with Jesus Christ.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for the promises that we find in Your Word. Help me Lord, to hold fast to those promises as Jacob held fast to the promise His grandfather Abraham had received. Bless our troops with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~When you wallow with pigs, expect to get dirty...

Our Meditation for Today:

By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau in regard to their future.

By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of Joseph's
sons, and worshiped as he leaned on the top of his staff...
(Heb. 11:20, 21) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jacob was Isaac's son and Abraham's grandson.
Jacob's sons became the fathers of Israel's 12 tribes...

Even when Jacob (also called "Israel") was dying in
a strange land, he believed the promise that Abraham's 
descendents would be like the sand on the seashore
and that Israel would become a great nation...

True faith helps us see beyond the grave. 
True faith brings us to a personal relationship 
with Jesus Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank You for the promises that we 
find in Your Word. Help me Lord, to hold fast to
those promises as Jacob held fast to the promise
His grandfather Abraham had received...Bless our 
troops with good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith Joseph, when his end was near, spoke about the exodus of the Israelites from Egypt and gave instructions about his bones. (Hebrews 11:22) NIV
reflection: Joseph, one of Jacob's sons, was sold into slavery by his jealous brothers (Genesis 37). Eventually, Joseph was sold again, this time to an official of the Pharaoh of Egypt. Because of Joseph's faithfulness to God, he was given the top-ranking position in Egypt. Although Joseph could have used that position to build a personal empire, he remembered God's promise to Abraham. After he had been reconciled to his brother, Joseph brought his family to be near him and requested that his bones be taken to the Promised Land when the Jews eventually left Egypt. Our lesson is that, faith means trusting God and doing what He wants, regardless of the circumstances or consequences.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the lesson that I have learned today from the life of Joseph. Help me to remain faithful to You regardless of circumstances or consequences. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The best sermons are lived, not preached...

Our Meditation for Today:

By faith Joseph, when his end was near, spoke about 
the exodus of the Israelites from Egypt and gave 
instructions about his bones...(Heb. 11:22) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Joseph, one of Jacob's sons, was sold into slavery by his
jealous brothers (Gen. 37). Eventually, Joseph was sold
again, this time to an official of the Pharaoh of Egypt...

Because of Joseph's faithfulness to God, he was given the
top-ranking position in Egypt. Although Joseph could have 
used that position to build a personal empire, he remembered 
God's promise to Abraham...

After he had been reconciled to his brother, Joseph brought
his family to be near him and requested that his bones be taken
to the Promised Land when the Jews eventually left Egypt...

Our lesson is that, faith means trusting God and doing what He
wants, regardless of the circumstances or consequences...

Our Prayer for Today:

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By faith Moses parents hid him for three months after he was born, because they saw he was no ordinary child, and they were not afraid of the King's edict. (Hebrews 11:23)
reflection: Moses' parents trusted God to protect their son's life. They were not merely proud parents; they were believers who had faith that God would care for him. As a parent, have you trusted God enough to take care of your children? God has a plan for every person, and your important task is to pray for your children and prepare them to do the work God has planned for them to do. Faith allows us to entrust even our children to God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, there is so much that I have learned from Old Testament people about faith and the importance of having a real faith in You. I know that it is important that I have this kind of faith that I might fulfill Your will in my life. I thank You that I can sleep feeling that my children ans well as my wife and myself are also safe. Amen.
